name: UGarbageCollectionSettings
doc: Implements the settings for garbage collection.

TimeBetweenPurgingPendingKillObjects: Time in seconds (game time) we should wait between purging object references to objects that are pending kill.
NumRetriesBeforeForcingGC: Maximum number of times GC can be skipped if worker threads are currently modifying UObject state. 0 = never force GC
MaxObjectsNotConsideredByGC: Maximum Object Count Not Considered By GC. Works only in cooked builds.
SizeOfPermanentObjectPool: Size Of Permanent Object Pool (bytes). Works only in cooked builds.
MaxObjectsInGame: Maximum number of UObjects that can exist in cooked game. Keep this as small as possible.
MaxObjectsInEditor: Maximum number of UObjects that can exist in the editor game. Make sure this can hold enough objects for the editor and commadlets within reasonable limit.
FlushStreamingOnGC: If enabled, streaming will be flushed each time garbage collection is triggered.
AllowParallelGC: If enabled, garbage collection will use multiple threads.
IncrementalBeginDestroyEnabled: If true, the engine will destroy objects incrementally using time limit each frame.
MultithreadedDestructionEnabled: If true, the engine will free objects' memory on a worker thread.
CreateGCClusters: If true, the engine will attempt to create clusters of objects for better garbage collection performance.
AssetClusteringEnabled: Whether to allow asset files to create actor clusters for GC.
ActorClusteringEnabled: Whether to allow levels to create actor clusters for GC.
UseDisregardForGCOnDedicatedServers: If false, DisregardForGC will be disabled for dedicated servers.
VerifyUObjectsAreNotFGCObjects: If true, the engine will throw a warning when it detects a UObject-derived class which also derives from FGCObject or any of its members is derived from FGCObject.
GarbageEliminationEnabled: If true, objects marked as Garbage will be automatically nulled and destroyed by Garbage Collector.
DumpObjectCountsToLogWhenMaxObjectLimitE: If true, the engine will dump UObject counts when maximum number of UObjects limit has been exceeded.
